intro: Tarachia polyodon, commonly known as the desert holly, is a perennial shrub native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its dense, spiny foliage and small, waxy, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has a deep root system that allows it to survive in harsh, dry environments. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a thick layer of hair to reduce water loss. Tarachia polyodon plays an important ecological role by providing shelter and food for various desert animals.
